ReportSection.Static:
Project Team and Roles

Please list all team members that participated in the project, including new members added since the last reporting period. To add or remove a member from the project, go to Edit Roles. If the person does not yet exist on the Forum, then you will need to go to Add Member. Both actions require staff/admin approval so expect some delay for the table to be updated.

ReportSection.name: Research Progress
ReportSection.title: 2. Project Milestones and Deliverables
ReportSection.ReportItem:
List all milestones and deliverables as approved in the original proposal and any subsequent amendments, and their status of completion. Also, list any milestones/deliverables that were removed/deleted or added since the approval of the original proposal.

Milestones

Year 1

{$item}

Year 2

{$item}

Deliverables

Year 1

{$item}

Year 2

{$item}

Incomplete, Delayed, Deleted or New Milestones/Deliverables

If applicable, explain why a milestone/deliverable was not completed, deleted, or why a new milestones/deliverable was added.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Research Findings
ReportSection.title: 3. Research Findings
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Key Findings & Achievements

Please list key project findings, products developed and achievements (short bullet points)

{$item}

Executive Summary

Provide an executive summary that describes the rationale, hypothesis, methodology and major research findings.

{$item}

Impact of Findings

Describe what you see as the major accomplishments and challenges of the project and what difference this project has made and will make to people, organizations and/or communities in your region. 

{$item}

Describe how this project addresses new and emerging ethical, legal, regulatory and social challenges?

{$item}

Design, Delivery and Implementation

Describe all your user recruitment activities and recruitment numbers over time. Recruitment activities can include media (social media, radio etc.), in-person presentations, community events, recruitment by community partners, etc.

{$item}

Is the platform, program etc. being delivered to the intended audience and are there equity deserving groups that are being underserved?

{$item}

Describe the interaction of users with the platform, program etc. (e.g., educational information, community database, coaching, Ask an Expert & other events). User interaction can include things like participation/attendance at in-person and online events, frequency and quality of engagement.

{$item}

What are the communication pathways between research staff and users? Examples of communication pathways with users may include newsletters [dates/frequency/reach]; in-person events for users; online events for users; etc.

{$item}

What do you consider an inactive user/participant of the platform, program etc.? How many registered users are currently considered inactive users? Why are these users, or why do you think these users are not engaged with the platform, program etc.?

{$item}

Describe how user feedback has been collected and monitored. How is user feedback being incorporated into the implementation and improvement of the platform, program etc.? How frequently is user feedback being solicited?

{$item}

As a result of collecting feedback from users describe whether users are satisfied or dissatisfied with the platform, programs etc. Are there differences in the satisfaction based on sex, gender, ethnicity? If possible, include verbatim quotes from users.

{$item}

As a result of collecting feedback from users describe if users have indicated any negative consequences of the platform, programs etc. Are there differences in negative consequences based on sex, gender, ethnicity? If possible, include verbatim quotes from users.

{$item}

As a result of collecting feedback from users describe if users are meeting their health behaviour goals? Are there differences in meeting goals based on sex, gender, ethnicity? If possible, include verbatim quotes from users.

{$item}

As a result of collecting feedback from users describe the barriers and facilitators that user have encountered with the platform, program etc. Are there differences based on sex, gender, ethnicity? If possible, include verbatim quotes from users.

{$item}

Contextual Factors

Describe any broader contextual factors (e.g., social, cultural, political context, organizational or community changes, leadership/partnership changes, etc.) and how they may have positively or negatively influenced the project activities and outcomes.

{$item}

Future Research Considerations

What major knowledge and research gaps remain to be studied?

{$item}

What are the steps you have taken or will take to continue this project after CFN funding?

{$item}

Other

Please provide any additional information you’d like to share regarding the study that has not been captured above.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: KTEE
ReportSection.tooltip: 4. Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation
ReportSection.title: 4. Knowledge and Technology Exchange and Exploitation
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Successes in KTEE

Describe all new products, processes, services or social innovations that have been developed in this project.

{$item}

Dissemination of Project Research Results

Please add all Refereed and Non-Refereed Publications, Specialized publications and Intellectual Property by going to Manage Products by clicking the button below. When you add these products please make sure that the product is associated with the project {$project_name}.

Manage Products

Please make sure that when in Managed Products you input all:

  • Refereed Contributions (i.e. articles, letters, notes, communications, review articles, papers in refereed conference proceedings, monographs, books, book chapters, government publications) (manuscripts may be included in an appendix).
    (Note: Include bibliographic details, in the following order: author(s), year of publication, title, book or journal name and number, pages and publisher.)
  • Non-Refereed Contributions (i.e. oral presentations, poster presentations, papers, letters, papers in conference proceedings, review articles)
  • Specialized Publications (i.e. industrial reports, thesis, technical reports, internal reports, discussions or abstracts, symposium records)
  • Intellectual Property and Licenses (i.e. patent applications, patents issued, copyrights, non-exclusive/exclusive licenses executed or under negotiation)
{$item}

Other Documents

If you would like to include any KTEE/research documents (e.g., conference poster presentations) please attach them below as a zip archive

{$item}

KTEE Implementation

Describe your KTEE activities and achievements.

{$item}

Describe KTEE activities you plan on doing or what do you recommend take place?

{$item}

Technology Exchange & Commercialization

Please describe any commercialization activities that have arisen from the study.

{$item}

Other

Please provide any additional information you’d like to share regarding KTEE that has not been captured above.

{$item}

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Provide a comparison of the actual cash and in-kind contributions from partners since award, with the projected commitments described in the original proposal. Explain changes in the level of partner commitment, if any. Detailed information should also be provided in the Financial Report spreadsheet.

Please carefully review information on expense eligibility, NCE-eligible partner, and contribution eligibility and valuation. Please consult your host institution’s research services unit if assistance is needed in determining eligibility and valuation of your project costs.

Tri-Agency Financial Administration Guide on the acceptable use of grant funds can be found at http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca/Professors-Professeurs/FinancialAdminGuide-guideAdminFinancier/FundsUse-UtilisationSubventions_eng.asp.

To calculate in-kind contribution amounts, please consult tri-council guidelines: http://www.nserc-crsng.gc.ca/NSERC-CRSNG/Policies-Politiques/orgpartners-orgpartenaires_eng.asp.

{$item}

ReportItem.labels: Name of partner|Main Sector|Sub-Sector|Describe the benefits & challenges of working with each partner, partnership activities and why the partner was chosen.

ReportSection.ReportItem:
Describe the significant partnership activities that occurred during this project. If any partnerships were dissolved over the course of the project, describe why.

{$item}

Describe how partnership feedback was collected and monitored. How was partnership feedback being incorporated into the implementation and improvement of the platform etc.? How frequently was partnership feedback being solicited?

{$item}

As a result of collecting feedback from partners describe whether partners were satisfied or dissatisfied with the platform, programs etc. If possible, include verbatim quotes from partners.

{$item}

As a result of collecting feedback from partners describe if partners indicated any negative consequences of the platform, programs etc. If possible, include verbatim quotes from partners.

{$item}

How has multidisciplinary and/or multisectoral partnerships and collaborations enhanced this study?

{$item}

If the work will continue beyond CFN funding describe how partnerships will be sustained, and how they will contribute to project sustainability.

{$item}

Please provide any additional information you’d like to share regarding partnerships that has not been captured above.

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Network Planning
ReportSection.title: 6. Network Planning Information
ReportSection.ReportItem:
Please assess your project against the following.

Research Findings

Have the research findings from this work been incorporated into a new grant submission for additional funding?

{$item}

If Yes, which agency have you applied for additional funding and what is the funding amount requested?

{$item}

If No, Do you anticipate submitting a grant for funding in the next 6 months?

{$item}

If Yes, which funding organization or Tri-Council agency will you be submitting to?

{$item}

Additional Research

Did this work lead to additional research funding being secured by you and/or other project team members?

{$item}

If Yes, please provide information on the funding organization or Tri-Council agency, the total funding awarded, length of the grant and title of the grant.

{$item}

Policy Makers

Any suggestions on how administrators or policy makers should use the study findings?

{$item}

ReportSection.name: Financial Report
ReportSection.title: 7. Financial Report
ReportSection.Instructions:
1. General: This Financial Reporting form contains three (3) tabs.
    1. Actual Expenditures up to March 31, 2015
    2. Supporting Detailed Information for CFN funds spent
    3. Supporting Detailed Information for Matching (Cash/In-kind) Contributions from Internal/External sources
  2. The shaded cells are locked to protect the template and the formulas. Please enter your figures and explanations in the clear cells provided in each tab.
    NOTE: CFN's fiscal year runs from April 1 to March 31, therefore, your budget/expenditure figures should match to the CFN fiscal year (e.g. a project with 1-year budget/expenditure may be covered by 2 CFN fiscal years).
  3. Financial Report ending March 31, 2014 CFN total expenditures incurred should equal Approved Form 300 box 11B. Form 300 for year ending March 31, 2015 should be posted to the FDSR system by May 1, 2015.
  4. Specific details of each field from Summary should be provided on the 3rd tab 'CFN funds spent Details' and the 4th tab 'Partner Contribution Details' accordingly.
  5. Partner Contribution Details:

    Detailed information should be provided by one table per each source of funding.

    Please carefully review information on expense eligibility, NCE-eligible partner, and contribution eligibility and valuation. Please consult your host institution’s research services unit if assistance is needed in determining eligibility and valuation of your project costs.

    Tri-Agency Financial Administration Guide on the acceptable use of grant funds can be found here.

    To calculate in-kind contribution amounts, please consult tri-council guidelines.

ReportItemSet.Static: If there are multiple leaders for this project, you can upload those budgets here.
